summary: Crypto exchange volumes fell to their lowest levels in almost three years, despite prices rising in October.
title: Crypto exchange volumes hit 23-month low
content: Global crypto exchange volumes have crashed to levels last seen in December 2020.

Cryptocurrency exchange volume in October was just $543 billion — down from $733 billion in September — according to The Block's data dashboard. The last time levels were this low was in December 2020, when they came in at $385 billion. (The same month, bitcoin hit multiple new all-time highs, trading above $28,000.)

October marked six months since the crypto downturn began and five months since the high-profile TerraUSD collapse. Prices were stagnant for most of the month before rallying last week. Volatility hit its lowest levels since July 2020 in October.

<iframe frameborder="0" height="420" src="https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/spot/cryptocurrency-exchange-volume-monthly/embed" title="Cryptocurrency Exchange Volume (The Block Legitimate Index)" width="100%" data-v-f87c67ca=""></iframe>
Binance accounted for the majority of crypto exchange volume — clocking in at $390 billion for the month.

<iframe frameborder="0" height="420" src="https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/spot/monthly-exchange-volume-the-block-legitimate-index-by-exchange/embed" title="Monthly Exchange Volume (The Block Legitimate Index - by Exchange)" width="100%" data-v-f87c67ca=""></iframe>
North American volumes fell to just over $78 billion.
Coinbase accounted for the majority of volumes in this region, with around 60% of the volumes — $46.9 billion — flowing through the exchange.

<iframe frameborder="0" height="420" src="https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/spot/north-america-based-customer-exchange-volume/embed" title="North America-Based Customer Exchange Volume" width="100%" data-v-f87c67ca=""></iframe>
Based on two exchanges, South America volumes were $9.4 billion — down slightly from September when volumes reached $11.6 billion. However, it shows an increase from August of more than $1 billion.

<iframe frameborder="0" height="420" src="https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/spot/south-america-based-exchange-volume/embed" title="South America-Based Exchange Volume" width="100%" data-v-f87c67ca=""></iframe>
Asian exchanges registered just $529 billion in October, the lowest since December 2020.

<iframe frameborder="0" height="420" src="https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/spot/asia-based-customer-exchange-volume/embed" title="Asia-Based Customer Exchange Volume" width="100%" data-v-f87c67ca=""></iframe>
In Europe, volumes fell to October 2020 lows — registering just $17.7 billion. European volumes fell just over 20% month-on-month.

<iframe frameborder="0" height="420" src="https://www.theblock.co/data/crypto-markets/spot/europe-based-customer-exchange-volume/embed" title="Europe-Based Customer Exchange Volume" width="100%" data-v-f87c67ca=""></iframe>
